How can I connect to a remote computer's: um, "mount" is used to mount refote fs's
the remote machine needs to see something like "ext3" but the nfs daemon on the remote end translates all to type nfs before interacting with incoming calls
to use what you said as example: sudo mount remotemachineaddress:/paths/and/stuff /your/local/mountpoint
correction: sudo mount -t nfs remotemachineaddress:/paths/and/stuff /your/local/mountpoint (ut's just that -t nfs has always been autosensed for me)
one good console irc client is irssi
